intro: Adenostemma microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Adenostemma microcephalum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
